title: Do most adults realize/remember that kids need to be TAUGHT how to do things?

author: sparkledproblems
text:
My mother wouldn't even teach me how to use a tampon. She made them this scary, "slutty" thing I had to BEG to use. I won't punish anyone with details but pads were not a good option for me even when I was young. For my cousins birthday we went to a Waterpark and I didnt want to miss it because of my period so she finally let me start using them. I was the oldest girl on a trip with all younger girls and my uncle.


She wouldn't buy them until we were waiting for my uncle to pick me up and go to the water park!!! I mean, she sent me clueless to figure out tampons for the first time alone and in public. She was adamant that Im fine on my own and she didn't want to talk about how vaginas work, at all. She didn't even send me with the box and instructions. My poor uncle had to try his best to teach me then when I was crying/embarrassed and decided to sit out all day, a lifeguard had to teach me with all of these grown women laughing and making fun of me in the bathroom.


I'm now starting to wonder if this is exactly what my mom wanted to happen, public shame and borderline traumatic embarrassment

author: sparkledproblems
text:
thank you.

She really made me think that it was something girls were just supposed to know how to do so it really felt like it was my fault they were making fun of me. Now I can't even fathom that grown, middle aged women reacted like that!

text:

I'm sorry you had to go through that trauma. Nparents suck so much ass.
